 O.k. I'll finish with the Mutants. Fill in the gaps and get the heck 
back to my other story(besides we'll have to go to Maximal city for 
Veratis to examine Stallex and if none of my characters exist I 
suppose his conversation with the Mutants is all a figment of 
Veratis's imagination).

--- In nbwrpg@y..., Legendarynemasis@a... wrote:
> Ok, First of all if you dont want to read an OOC post styop reading 
now and 
> go to the next IC message. I gave you warning in the subject line 
too.
> 
> No... you cant do two things at once. You never posted for mustex 
leaving to 
> anywhere or arriving anywhere. Or getting the Hover Cycles 
anywhere. Yan told 
> you earlier about having to post for every action taken. And it is 
in the 
> rules. If you dont know the rules will be glad to supply you with a 
link in 
> this mail and c/p the rule in which it says you must post for 
leaving and 
> arriving in an area. Heh this should actually save the council and 
Yan some 
> trouble since Yan is really busy anyways.
> 
> Link: http://www.nbwrpg.com/rules.shtml
> 
> Now for the traveling rule as well as some other rules I believe 
you are not 
> aware of:
> 
> #1 Do not manage other people's characters in any way, shape, or 
form. This 
> means that you cannot control them, post damage for them, etc.
> 
> 
> #8 Do not go vast distances in one post. If you're going from South 
Africa to 
> Europe, post your char leaving, and in about half a day or so, post 
him/her 
> arriving.
> 
> #9
> The following weapons are banned. If you wish to bring in 
new/original 
> weapons, get them authorized by the council. You may not have any 
of the 
> following under any condition: 
> any sort of seeking missiles 
> shockwaves and EMP shots 
> flare bombs/flash grenades 
> Weaponry that defies shields of bases and ships
> (This one I got hit with but its my fault for not following this 
rule in the 
> first place, which reminds me I need to edit some bios...)
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> 
> Well I hoped this mail helped you dewboy and I hoped it helped the 
council as 
> well since they don't need to state the rules a billionth time 
since I just 
> gave you a link to them. Unless of course you violate the rules.
